com.addicticks.net.httpsupload

Class HttpsFileUploaderConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.addicticks.net.httpsupload.HttpsFileUploaderConfig

  • public class HttpsFileUploaderConfig
extends Object
    Encapsulation of configuration values for the connection to a HTTP or HTTPS server.

    Addicticks

    • Field Detail

      • CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS

        public static final int CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS
        Default connect timeout on the URL connection. (value in milliseconds)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • READ_TIMEOUT_MS

        public static final int READ_TIMEOUT_MS
        Default read timeout on the URL connection. This is the time from the point where all the data in the HTTP POST message has been sent to the server and to the point where the server replies. (value in milliseconds)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpsFileUploaderConfig

        public HttpsFileUploaderConfig(URL url)
        Creates a configuration object with only the URL endpoint defined. The following defaults apply:


        • No use of authentication on endpoint
        • No use of proxy
        • Certificates from the endpoint are validated
        The defaults can be changed by subsequent calls to the setter methods.
        Parameters:
        url - Sets the URL of the endpoint. This is expected to start with either a HTTP or a HTTPS url. The URL can optionally include a port number.

    • Method Detail

      • getEndpointUsername

        public String getEndpointUsername()
        Gets the endpoint authentication username (authentication type: Basic). Returns null if the setEndpointUsername(java.lang.String) hasn't been called. A value of null indicates that the endpoint does not require authentication.
        Returns:
        username to use for authentication

      • setEndpointUsername

        public void setEndpointUsername(String endpointUsername)
        Sets the username for authentication against the endpoint. Do not set this if the endpoint does not require authentication. Only authentication of type "Basic" is currently supported.
        Parameters:
        endpointUsername - username to use for authentication

      • getEndpointPassword

        public String getEndpointPassword()
        Gets the endpoint authentication password (authentication type: Basic). Returns null if the setEndpointPassword(java.lang.String) hasn't been called. A value of null indicates that the endpoint does not require authentication.
        Returns:
        un-encrypted password.

      • setEndpointPassword

        public void setEndpointPassword(String endpointPassword)
        Sets the un-encrypted password for authentication against the endpoint. Do not set this if the endpoint does not require authentication. Only authentication of type "Basic" is currently supported.
        Parameters:
        endpointPassword - un-encrypted password

        public void setValidateCertificates(boolean validateCertificates)
        Should certificates from the endpoint be validated ? Default is true. Set to false if the endpoint is trusted but is using a self-signed certificate.
        Parameters:
        validateCertificates -

      • setProxyAddress

        public void setProxyAddress(String proxyAddress)
        Sets the address of the proxy. If the connection does not need to go through a proxy server in order to reach its endpoint then do not use this method.
        Parameters:
        proxyAddress - either a string hostname or an IP addresss. Must not include a port number.

        See Also:

      • setProxyPort

        public void setProxyPort(int proxyPort)
        Sets the port of the proxy. If the connection does not need to go through a proxy server in order to reach its endpoint then do not use this method.
        Parameters:
        proxyPort - port number, a value between 1 and 65535. Typically HTTP/HTTPS proxies use port 8080 by convention.

      • getAcceptedIssuers

        public String[] getAcceptedIssuers()
        Gets list of accepted Issuer Organization names that will be accepted for the server's certificate.
        Returns:
        the list of accepted Issuer Organization names that will be accepted for the server's certificate or null if all Issuer Organization names are accepted.
        See Also:
        setAcceptedIssuers(java.lang.String[])

      • setAcceptedIssuers

        public void setAcceptedIssuers(String[] acceptedIssuers)
        Sets the list of Issuer Organization names that will be accepted for the server's certificate.

        This feature works only when isValidateCertificates() is false.

        The purpose of the feature is to provide some minimal security rather than simply accepting any certificate. If - for example - you create a self-signed certificate then you decide the 'issuer organization' yourself and the issuer organization name you used when you created the certificate can then be validated here.

        Parameters:
        acceptedIssuers - accept only a certificate from one of these issuer organizations. Check is done against the Organization (O) field in the 'Issued By' section of the server's certificate. A null means all issuer organizations are accepted.
